ygData.subject: Help! "No space left on device" left my crawl unusable
ygData.msgSnippet: I just had a crawl using the latest heritrix run out of disk space and it is now in an unusable state.  This is surprising me as I ve had crawls with 1.8 run

Subject: Help! "No space left on device" left my crawl unusable
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=39397245; y=9h2_uZoaEEK9vk6ju9QI4VPz2P8DpkMEvN18RhTNFwgQx-idgA

I just had a crawl using the latest heritrix run out of disk space and
it is now in an unusable state.  This is surprising me as I've had
crawls with 1.8 run out but they just waited for free space and
carried on when there was some.  My crawl is now stuck saying all
threads are active but producing alerts such as the following, just
counting up the retries and doing nothing:

02/03/2007 17:05:42 +0000 WARNING org.archive.io.WriterPool borrowFile Timeout waiting for idle object: Retry #0 of  max of 10: NSEE Pool State: Active 5 of max 5, idle 0, time 300066ms of max 300000ms

Not sure what got it into this seemingly leaked-WriterPool-state, as
there where a few types of IOExceptions (see below).  But now I don't
really know what to do because checkpoints are failing too.  It takes
a long time to pause it, and then I get the following error.  It
appears it's failing to write out the HttpRecorderGetMethod from
FetchHTTP (that's what javap tells me FetchHTTP$2 is) which is somehow
stuck in the AList of a CandidateURI that is in a WorkQueue (maybe its
peekItem member?) on the WorkQueueFrontier.inProcessQueues.  Searching
the code, I have no idea how the HttpRecorderGetMethod is getting put
in this AList, but obviously it shouldn't be there if we're going to
serialize that list.

Any ideas?  It's looking to me like I'll need to terminate the crawl
and recover it from the recover.gz log.  Are those cumulative or not?
i.e. I actually have recover.gz.00001, 00002, etc.  Do I just use the
latest one to recover or do I need to concatenate them or something?

Thanks,
eric
